flawed_nl_solution:
Tim has 152 photos - 100 photos = <<152-100=50>>50 photos.
When Tim has 50 photos, then Paul has 50 + 10 photos = <<50+10=60>>60 photos.
Tim and Paul have together 50 photos + 60 photos = <<50+60=110>>110 photos.
That leaves Tom with 152 photos - 110 photos = <<152-110=42>>42 photos.
#### 42

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 52, not 50. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
